identificationModule.briefTitle: Music and Adherence Home Programs Post Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Music and Adherence in Upper Extremity Home Programs Post Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to explore whether adherence to upper extremity home programs changes when persons post stroke practice with preferred music.

armGroups.label: Preferred Music Playlist
armGroups.description: All participants will have this phase twice in the protocol. See description in intervention section.

interventions.name: Preferred music playlist
interventions.description: Client will be instructed in a home program based on repetitive task practice principles and will complete this program with and without the use of a preferred music playlist during practice.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Perceived occupational performance on activities of importance to the client
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and no more than one week post intervention period

secondaryOutcomes.description: Perceived amount and quality of use of the affected upper extremity
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and no more than one week post intervention period

otherOutcomes.description: One-to-one interview with supported communication strategies on the experience of the intervention and study materials.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: No more than 3 weeks post intervention period

otherOutcomes.description: Rate of accelerations as measured by an activity monitor

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Ages 40-85
* Mild to Moderate hemiparesis as determined by a score of 21 to 50 on the FM- UE
* At least 6 months post stroke
* American English as primary language

Exclusion Criteria:

* Significant visual impairment as determined by "aphasia-friendly" and age appropriate screening
* Significant hearing impairment as determined by self-report
* Actively receiving occupational or physical therapy services for upper extremity motor recovery
* Severe auditory comprehension impairment such that they cannot understand one-step directions as indicated by a WAB-R score below 8/10 on Sequential Commands Subtest
* Sitting or standing blood pressure of 180/110 or HE \> 100 bpm

locations.facility: Duquesne University Speech, Hearing, Language Clinic
